subtitle.line1: This tool generates an accessible design system from a few simple settings (colors, typography and radius).
subtitle.line2: Contrasts are automatically checked according to WCAG 2.2 level AA criteria.
subtitle.line3: As long as accessibility is not respected, export is intentionally blocked.

colors.title: Colors
colors.intro: Define the main colors of your interface. Secondary colors (onAccent, hover, border) are automatically calculated to ensure sufficient contrast. Changes are applied in real time: favor progressive adjustments.
colors.accent: Main action color (buttons, links, interactive elements).
colors.bg: Global background color. It strongly influences text readability.
colors.card: Background color for content blocks (cards, panels). Useful for creating visual hierarchy.
colors.text: Main text color. Must always maintain sufficient contrast with the background.
colors.textSecondary: Secondary text (hints, metadata). Contrast automatically checked against Card color.
colors.onAccent: Auto-chosen (black/white) to maximize contrast on Accent.
colors.border: Generated from text color for subtle separators.

typography.title: Typography & Radius
typography.intro: Typography uses fluid sizes (clamp) to adapt to different screen sizes. Values are entered in px (understandable), then converted to rem in CSS (better for zoom and user preferences).
typography.clampHelp: We set a minimum size, an 'ideal' size that varies with screen width, and a maximum size: this avoids writing media queries just for typography.
typography.minLimit: For accessibility, the minimum size is limited to 12px: below that, text quickly becomes difficult to read (low vision, pixel density, browser zoom).
typography.radiusHelp: Radii define component rounding: sm (small elements), md (buttons/cards), lg (modals/panels). Consistent radii improve visual hierarchy.
typography.wcagIntro: These checks ensure compliance with AA level for normal text (4.5:1 threshold). Visual comfort then depends on context and end users.

preview.title: Preview & Export
preview.intro: Preview of components generated from tokens. Once all accessibility rules are validated, export becomes available.
preview.copyDisabled: Copy disabled: WCAG AA contrast required
